answers.answer:
Yes, UNHCR provides a cash assistance program in Romania for eligible Ukrainians and third-country nationals displaced by the ongoing conflict.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr and read the content under the section "Information about UNHCR’s Cash Programme in Romania".
answers.bResponse:
Yes, UNHCR provides a cash assistance program in Romania for eligible Ukrainians and third-country nationals displaced by the ongoing conflict.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr and read the content under the section "Information about UNHCR’s Cash Programme in Romania". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr

answers.answer:
Individuals displaced from Ukraine (including Ukrainian citizens, stateless persons, and third-country nationals) are eligible for UNHCR cash assistance in Romania if they have registered with temporary protection status and lived in Romania for at least 30 days. Additionally, their family must meet at least one specific vulnerability criterion (such as having a family member with a disability, being a single parent, an adult over 60, a household with four or more members, or a single young man aged 18-21) and not be receiving similar cash assistance from other sources.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr and look under the section titled "Who is eligible for UNHCR cash assistance?".
answers.bResponse:
Individuals displaced from Ukraine (including Ukrainian citizens, stateless persons, and third-country nationals) are eligible for UNHCR cash assistance in Romania if they have registered with temporary protection status and lived in Romania for at least 30 days. Additionally, their family must meet at least one specific vulnerability criterion (such as having a family member with a disability, being a single parent, an adult over 60, a household with four or more members, or a single young man aged 18-21) and not be receiving similar cash assistance from other sources.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr and look under the section titled "Who is eligible for UNHCR cash assistance?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr

answers.answer:
To apply for UNHCR cash assistance, eligible individuals must fill out a registration form, after which they will receive a text message inviting them for an interview at an enrollment center. During the interview, applicants need to provide identification documents for all family members, proof of entry into Romania, an active mobile number, fingerprints, and Romanian bank account details.

To find detailed information, please go to the website and read under the sections "Scheduling an appointment to register for Cash assistance by UNHCR", "What should I bring to my enrolment appointment?", "Why do I need to provide my fingerprints to receive cash assistance from UNHCR?", and "What documents do I need to provide about my bank account?".
answers.bResponse:
To apply for UNHCR cash assistance, eligible individuals must fill out a registration form, after which they will receive a text message inviting them for an interview at an enrollment center. During the interview, applicants need to provide identification documents for all family members, proof of entry into Romania, an active mobile number, fingerprints, and Romanian bank account details.

To find detailed information, please go to the website and read under the sections "Scheduling an appointment to register for Cash assistance by UNHCR", "What should I bring to my enrolment appointment?", "Why do I need to provide my fingerprints to receive cash assistance from UNHCR?", and "What documents do I need to provide about my bank account?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr

answers.answer:
UNHCR provides one-time cash assistance of 720 lei per person.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the "Information about UNHCR’s Cash Programme in Romania" section and look under the heading "How much money is provided as cash assistance?".

answers.answer:
To register for UNHCR cash assistance, you need to bring identification documents for all family members (such as international passport, national ID, birth certificate, or Temporary Protection Permit), a document proving your date of entry into Romania, and an active Romanian or Ukrainian mobile phone number.

You can find the detailed list of required documents on the webpage under the section "What should I bring to my enrolment appointment?".

answers.answer:
UNHCR cash assistance enrollment centers are located in Bucharest (at pavilion G5 ROMEXPO - Marasti Boulevard, 65-67), Brasov (Strada Bogdan Petriceiu Hasdeu, no 13), Galati (Movilei Street, 2-8), Iasi (Sos. Nationala, no 55-59, Mercury Apartments, flats 1-2), and Suceava (Mihail Sadoveanu Street, 9A).

To find more detailed information, please go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr` and read under the section titled "Where are UNHCR’s Cash Enrolment Points?".

Nationala, no 55-59, Mercury Apartments, flats 1-2), and Suceava (Mihail Sadoveanu Street, 9A).

answers.answer:
UNHCR cash assistance enrollment centers are open 5 days a week, from Monday to Friday, from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm, and are closed on weekends.

To find this information on the webpage, please visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr and look under the section titled "Where are UNHCR’s Cash Enrolment Points? When are they open?".

answers.answer:
Yes, an appointment is necessary to register for UNHCR cash assistance. It is the first step to enroll in the program, and you will only be interviewed if you have been invited to an appointment at one of UNHCR's enrolment centres.

To find more detailed information, please read the sections titled "Scheduling an appointment to register for Cash assistance by UNHCR" and "What is UNHCR’s financial cash assistance programme in Romania?" on the webpage.

You will receive a text message on your mobile phone within a maximum of 15 days, indicating the date, time, and location of your appointment.

To find this information on the webpage, go to `https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr` and look under the section titled "Scheduling an appointment to register for Cash assistance by UNHCR."

answers.answer:
No, you are generally not eligible for UNHCR cash assistance if you are already receiving multi-purpose cash assistance or vouchers from other sources in Romania (equivalent to RON 600 or more) or from UNHCR in another European country. This also applies if you are receiving at least 500 RON per month per person for two or three months from another program.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the sections titled "Who is eligible for UNHCR cash assistance?" and "I am receiving Cash Assistance from another organization. Am I eligible for Cash for Protection assistance?".
answers.bResponse:
No, you are generally not eligible for UNHCR cash assistance if you are already receiving multi-purpose cash assistance or vouchers from other sources in Romania (equivalent to RON 600 or more) or from UNHCR in another European country. This also applies if you are receiving at least 500 RON per month per person for two or three months from another program.

To find this detailed information, go to the website and read under the sections titled "Who is eligible for UNHCR cash assistance?" and "I am receiving Cash Assistance from another organization. Am I eligible for Cash for Protection assistance?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr

answers.answer:
UNHCR collects fingerprints for cash assistance enrollment to protect your unique access to financial assistance and guard against fraud, making it difficult for someone else to impersonate you.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the section titled "Why do I need to provide my fingerprints to receive cash assistance from UNHCR?".
answers.bResponse:
UNHCR collects fingerprints for cash assistance enrollment to protect your unique access to financial assistance and guard against fraud, making it difficult for someone else to impersonate you.

To find this information on the webpage, go to the section titled "Why do I need to provide my fingerprints to receive cash assistance from UNHCR?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr

answers.answer:
To receive UNHCR cash assistance, you need to provide the IBAN number and the date your account was opened for a Romanian bank account. Bank accounts from Ukraine or other countries are not accepted.

To find this detailed information, go to the webpage and read under the section titled "What documents do I need to provide about my bank account?".

answers.answer:
To update your phone number or family composition for UNHCR cash assistance, you must physically visit the nearest UNHCR enrolment center. For changes in family composition, all family members need to be present to update your details and supporting documentation.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage by looking under the sections titled "I have changed my phone number. Can I update it remotely by e-mail or phone?" and "What should I do if I want to change my family composition (birth of babies, marriages and divorces, death of family members) or family focal point?".
answers.bResponse:
To update your phone number or family composition for UNHCR cash assistance, you must physically visit the nearest UNHCR enrolment center. For changes in family composition, all family members need to be present to update your details and supporting documentation.

You can find this detailed information on the webpage by looking under the sections titled "I have changed my phone number. Can I update it remotely by e-mail or phone?" and "What should I do if I want to change my family composition (birth of babies, marriages and divorces, death of family members) or family focal point?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr

answers.answer:
UNHCR cash assistance is disbursed directly to a Romanian bank account after providing banking details, or it can be picked up via MoneyGram or Smith & Smith using a pick-up code. Alternatively, it can be cashed out from a Romanian bank counter or withdrawn from an ATM with a debit card.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr and refer to sections such as "What documents do I need to provide about my bank account?" and "Do I need a Proof of Enrolment document for picking up assistance from MoneyGram, a bank or Smith &Smith?".
answers.bResponse:
UNHCR cash assistance is disbursed directly to a Romanian bank account after providing banking details, or it can be picked up via MoneyGram or Smith & Smith using a pick-up code. Alternatively, it can be cashed out from a Romanian bank counter or withdrawn from an ATM with a debit card.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr and refer to sections such as "What documents do I need to provide about my bank account?" and "Do I need a Proof of Enrolment document for picking up assistance from MoneyGram, a bank or Smith &Smith?". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/financial-support-from-unhcr

answers.answer:
You have a total of 20 days to pick up UNHCR cash assistance sent via MoneyGram from the time you receive the SMS with your pickup code.

To find this information on the webpage, look for the section titled "How much time do I have for picking up the cash assistance when sent through MoneyGram?".
